thread.title: Some sickle cell patients back in ER as clinic closes
thread.title_full: Some sickle cell patients back in ER as clinic closes - FOX 8 WVUE New Orleans News, Weather, Sports, Social

author: cbs8
title: Some sickle cell patients back in ER as clinic closes
text:
JACKSON, Miss. (AP) - Some patients with sickle cell disease say they're back to having long waits in emergency rooms since the University of Mississippi Medical Center temporarily closed a clinic that was designed to help them.
The clinic closed in August - 14 months after it opened. UMMC administrators say they're looking for a new location and are in the process of hiring a nurse for the clinic, which they hope to re-open by year's end.
The medical center says the original site was never meant to be permanent.
Josh Foxi, a Jackson-area musician and medical student, has sickle cell disease. He tells The Clarion-Ledger ( http://on.thec-l.com/1kdxt8H ) that patients are back in emergency rooms since the clinic's closure.
An estimated 2,000 to 2,500 Mississippians have sickle cell disease, which can cause painful blood-flow problems.
